services.name: ScriptScore AI
services.overview:
ScriptScore AI is an automated script analysis tool designed to provide rapid and objective scoring of screenplays and teleplays. This service leverages advanced natural language processing and machine learning techniques to evaluate scripts across key elements such as plot, character development, dialogue quality, and overall marketability. By analyzing thousands of existing scripts and coverage reports, ScriptScore AI offers a data-driven assessment, helping coverage agencies, studios, and production companies streamline their script evaluation process.

The core value proposition of ScriptScore AI lies in its ability to reduce the time and subjectivity inherent in traditional script reading. Junior readers can quickly filter out low-potential scripts based on AI-generated scores, allowing them to focus on more promising submissions. This not only accelerates the evaluation pipeline but also ensures a more consistent and unbiased assessment across all scripts.

ScriptScore AI generates a comprehensive score dashboard for each script, highlighting strengths and weaknesses in various categories. This detailed feedback empowers writers to identify areas for improvement and helps decision-makers make informed choices about which projects to pursue. The service integrates seamlessly with existing script submission workflows and provides actionable insights to enhance script quality and market success.

The system incorporates a multi-faceted scoring system, providing individual scores for plot structure, character depth, dialogue effectiveness, pacing, and originality. These individual scores contribute to an overall score reflecting the script's potential. Each score is accompanied by a rationale generated by the AI, offering specific examples from the script to support its evaluation. 

ScriptScore AI is offered as a SaaS product with tiered subscription plans based on the number of scripts analyzed per month. Additional features such as comparative analysis across scripts and integration with scriptwriting software are available as premium add-ons.
problems_addressed: Subjectivity and bias in manual script reading and scoring.
Time constraints and delays in script coverage turnaround.
Difficulty in identifying high-potential scripts quickly and efficiently.
Lack of data-driven insights to inform script development decisions.
core_features: Automated Script Scoring – AI-powered analysis that generates scores for plot, character, dialogue, and overall quality. The score is presented with clear, visualized metrics.
Comprehensive Score Dashboard – Detailed breakdown of script strengths and weaknesses with specific examples from the script to justify the scoring.
Comparative Analysis – Ability to compare scores across multiple scripts to identify top contenders.
Customizable Scoring Metrics – Option to adjust the weighting of different scoring elements to align with specific preferences or criteria.
Integration with Submission Platforms – Seamless integration with existing script submission and management systems.
user_journeys: A script reader logs into ScriptScore AI, uploads a new script file (e.g., .pdf, .fdx), and initiates the AI analysis. The system processes the script and generates a score dashboard within minutes. The reader reviews the scores, reads the AI-generated rationale, and uses the insights to prioritize their reading list, focusing on scripts with higher potential.
ai_capabilities: Natural Language Processing (NLP) to analyze script text and extract key elements such as plot points, character interactions, and dialogue patterns.
Machine Learning (ML) model trained on thousands of scripts and coverage reports to predict script quality and marketability.
Sentiment analysis to gauge emotional tone and audience engagement potential.
The primary model will be a fine-tuned GPT-4 or equivalent large language model specifically trained on screenplay data.
Embeddings of script segments will be generated using OpenAI's `text-embedding-ada-002` model and stored in a vector database.
Vector search will be used to identify similar scripts and benchmark the current script's performance.
Fine-tuning will involve a dataset of scripts with corresponding coverage reports, ratings, and box office performance data.

data_schema_recommendations: **Scripts Table:** script_id (UUID), title (TEXT), author (TEXT), genre (TEXT), logline (TEXT), script_content (TEXT), upload_date (TIMESTAMP)
**Scores Table:** score_id (UUID), script_id (UUID, FK), plot_score (FLOAT), character_score (FLOAT), dialogue_score (FLOAT), overall_score (FLOAT), rationale (JSONB)
**Embeddings Table:** script_id (UUID, FK), segment (TEXT), embedding (VECTOR(1536)) – Uses vector extension.
Consider using JSONB columns in PostgreSQL for storing unstructured data like AI-generated rationales.
data_sources: Internal database of scripts and coverage reports (for fine-tuning)
External script databases (e.g., Coverfly, Black List – with appropriate licensing)
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: Ensure compliance with GDPR and CCPA regulations regarding user data privacy. Implement secure storage and handling of script files. Obtain necessary licenses for using copyrighted scripts in the training dataset.

required_integrations: CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot) for managing customer accounts.
Email providers (e.g., SendGrid, Mailgun) for automated notifications and reports.
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for secure API authentication. Clerk or Auth0 are recommended for user authentication and authorization management.

technical_specifications.architecture: The system consists of a frontend application, a backend API layer, a database for storing scripts and scores, and an AI pipeline for script analysis. The AI pipeline will process scripts, generate scores, and store embeddings. The API layer exposes endpoints for script upload, analysis, and score retrieval.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with pgvector extension for embeddings storage
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob for storing script files
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API (GPT-4 or similar), embeddings (OpenAI `text-embedding-ada-002`), vector DB (Pinecone/Supabase vectors)
recommended_tech_stack.APIs: REST API for communication between frontend and backend

API_design: **POST /api/scripts:** Upload a new script. Payload: { title: string, author: string, genre: string, script_file: file }. Returns: { script_id: UUID }.

**GET /api/scripts/{script_id}:** Retrieve script details and scores. Returns: { script_id: UUID, title: string, author: string, genre: string, plot_score: float, character_score: float, dialogue_score: float, overall_score: float, rationale: JSONB }.
**POST /api/scripts/{script_id}/analyze:** Initiate AI analysis for a script. Returns: { status: 'processing' | 'completed' }.
**GET /api/scripts?search={query}:** Search for scripts by title or author. Returns: [{ script_id: UUID, title: string, author: string }].
frontend_components: Script Upload Form: Component for uploading script files and entering metadata.
Score Dashboard: Component displaying script scores, rationale, and visualizations.
Script Viewer: Component for displaying the script text with highlighted sections based on AI analysis.
Search Bar: Component for searching scripts by title or author.

deployment_instructions: Environment variables: OPENAI_API_KEY, DATABASE_URL, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, JWT_SECRET
Vercel deployment: Connect GitHub repository to Vercel. Configure environment variables in Vercel settings. Enable automatic deployments on push.
Build outputs: Next.js static and serverless functions.
Runtime settings: Node.js version 18 or higher.

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers: Free (limited scripts), Basic (10 scripts/month), Pro (50 scripts/month), Enterprise (unlimited scripts).
Usage-based pricing: Pay-per-script analysis for occasional users.
Add-ons: Comparative analysis, integration with scriptwriting software, custom scoring metrics.

success_metrics: Operational KPIs: Number of scripts analyzed per month, script analysis time, API response time.
AI performance KPIs: Accuracy of script scoring (measured against human coverage reports), correlation between AI scores and box office performance, user satisfaction with AI rationale.
Adoption/engagement KPIs: Number of active users, subscription renewal rate, feature usage (e.g., comparative analysis), customer lifetime value.
